creator: dan.a.seyb@ameritech.com
text:
It would be nice to have a way to stop a test plan.

If the server crashes from the load, or the login process rejects the user id,
there is no point in running the rest of the tests.

An enhanced assertion might be an easy way to add this, although that is just a 
suggestion.

creator: M.Kostrzewa@pentacomp.com.pl
text:
Generalization: 
Every controller (and thread) should have following options: 
1) In case of failure start next iteration (adequate to 'continue' keyword) 
2) In case of failure skip current and all furher iterations (adequate to 
'break' keyword)

creator: chezhiyan@siptech.co.in
text:
For stopping the TestPlan we provided  three ways
    1.Continue TestPlan
    2.Stop TestPlan
    3.Remove the Sampler  and Continue the TestPlan
           in each controller. User can select these options in the controller
GUI.

  1.Continue TestPlan
      In this condition any of the sampler fails, it will continue the TestPlan
  2.Stop TestPlan
     In this condition  any of the sampler fails, it will stop the TestPlan
  3.Remove the Sampler and continue the TestPlan
     In this condition  any of the sampler fails, it will remove the failed
sampler and continue the testplan, so that the failed sampler will not be
executed in the subsequent iterations

see attachment  5244

Partly completed.

Thread Groups now have 3 options when a failed sample is detected:
* Continue (present behaviour)
* Stop Thread
* Stop Test

Samplers (and Listeners) can also call the methods setStopTest() or 
setStopThread() on any sample if they detect the sort of error that precludes 
continuing, but this has to be added to the sampler code at present.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
There's also now a Result Status Action handler which can be used to stop a 
thread/test after a failed sample.
